intro: Gossypium capitis-viridis, commonly known as the green-headed cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its cotton-like seeds are enclosed in fluffy bolls, typical of the cotton genus. Gossypium capitis-viridis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
